KnowledgeBase.Title: nmod
KnowledgeBase.HumanKeywords: number arithmetic mod division remainder operators

Function.Description: The nmod Function divides two numbers and returns the remainder.

Brief.Overview: The nmod function divides two numbers and returns the remainder. The nmod function performs an integer divide, but the operands and result is type Number. The nmod function does not perform type checking or type conversion on the operands
Brief.Usage: The nmod built-in function is a simple but very fast numeric remainder function that assumes that all of its arguments are type Number. The nmod built-in function is used to determine if a Number will divide evenly into another Number (the remainder will be zero in this case). Some software vendors supply libraries may have a function named remainder that performs the same action as nmod. An alternate function, is the mod function, which performs type checking and type conversion on numeric operands.

Syntax.Return: The remainder resulting from the integer division. The result is expressed as a Number.
